lead_paragraph: The ballyhooed renewal of the Lakers-Celtics rivalry in the N.B.A. finals did not generate spectacular viewership for Game 1 Thursday night compared with the Lakers’ last appearance in the finals four years ago. Los Angeles is the nation’s No. 2 market. ABC could boast that it defeated its prime-time competition and won in all the key demographics. And while the 13.4 million viewers watching Game 1 represented a 45 percent increase over the 9.2 million who saw the Spurs-Cavaliers opener last year, the game drew 13 percent fewer viewers than Game 1 of the 2004 Lakers-Pistons finals.
